title: The Stellar Cycles Pulsar is a $500 Single Speed Frame
content:
The Stellar Cycles Pulsar is sort of a do-all type of bike as long as it’s singlespeed. This unique offering caught our eye on Instagram, and we’re sharing it here because we think you’ll dig it, too!

It was designed to use just about every form of rear hub besides belt drive. If you want the Pulsar to be single-speed, fixed gear, coaster brake, internally geared, or externally geared*, it can handle what you throw at it! If external gears is your game plan then you’ll need to purchase a Problem Solvers derailleur hanger/tensioner combo. The Pulsar was designed so that you don’t have to buy the latest technology like many other frames make you do these days.

These frames are made in Peru and feature a tough powder coat finish. They retail for $500. Check out the single frame size geometry at Stellar’s Instagram post.

Frame Specifications

  • Wheel size: 29″
  • Rear Tire Clearance:  29×2.8″
  • Head Tube:  1 1/8″
  • Head Tube Angle: 69 degrees
  • Top Tube Length: 610mm
  • Reach: 596.9mm
  • Seat Tube Length: 485mm
  • Sear Tube Angle:  74 degrees
  • BB Drop:  324mm
  • Chain Stay Length: 432mm
  • Seat Tube Inner Diameter:  31.6
  • Bottom Bracket:  73mm BSA
  • Brake Mounts:  I.S. Mounts Disc
  • Dropouts Size:  135x10mm

Fork Specifications

  • Steerer: 1 1/8″
  • Length / ATC: 480mm
  • Rake / Offset: 45mm
  • Axle: 10mm
  • Dropouts Width: 100mm
  • Disc Brake mounts: IS Mount
  • Tire Width: 29x 2.8”
  • Braze Ons: Anything Cage

See more at Stellar Cycles’ Instagram.
